conclusion: Use Faraday's law of electromagnetic induction to find the magnitude of the induced emf in the coil.
The formula for emf induced in a coil rotating in a uniform magnetic field is \( \mathcal{E} = n B A \omega \sin(\omega t) \).
Explanation of variables: \( n \) is the number of turns, \( B \) is the magnetic induction intensity, \( A \) is the area, \( \omega \) is the angular velocity, \( t \) is the time.
Timing starts when the coil plane passes through the neutral plane, so \( t = 0 \) and \( \sin(\omega t) = \sin(0) = 0 \).
Calculate the area \( A \) of the coil: \( A = l_{AB} \times l_{BC} = 0.2 \, \text{m} \times 0.5 \, \text{m} = 0.1 \, \text{m}^2 \).
Substitute values into the formula for peak emf: \( \mathcal{E}_{\text{peak}} = n B A \omega \).
The magnitude of the induced electromotive force in the coil is \( \boxed{314.16 \, \text{V}} \).
